components.description: The word "top" with an arrow pointing up above it.
components.title: Top with Upwards Arrow Above

description: The word "top" with an arrow pointing up above it.
title: Top with Upwards Arrow Above

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Words with arrows
emoji_net_data.definition: The word "top" with an arrow pointing up above it. TOP Arrow was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name ‚ÄúTop With Upwards Ar http://emojipedia.org/top-with-upwards-arrow-above/
emoji_net_data.name: TOP arrow

bn:00113406a: Being or moving higher in position or greater in some value; being above a former position or level

bn:00113407a: Extending or moving toward a higher place
Moving up, directed toward a higher place.

apple_vendor_description: The top arrow emoji on Apple devices is a bold, upward-pointing chevron, rendered with Apple's signature glossy finish and clean, sharp edges. Its bright, energetic hue and subtle 3D shading give it a dynamic feel, signifying direction, advancement, or a command to move upwards. This emoji on Apple devices is commonly used to indicate the top of a page, a return to the beginning, or a positive trajectory.
